snippet: Criminal prosecution of bullies is rare and unlikely to yield results for the family of Amanda Cummings, who jumped in front of a city bus.
abstract: Criminal prosecution of bullies is rare and unlikely to yield results for the family of Amanda Cummings, who jumped in front of a city bus.
lead_paragraph: The police said Wednesday that "no criminality is suspected" in the case of the 15-year-old Staten Island girl who died Monday after jumping in front of a city bus, and whose uncle alleged that bullying at school was partly to blame.

headline.main: No Charges Expected in Staten Island Girl's Suicide
